text: We service about 8 million customers in Australia.
We have a personal bank, a business bank,

and a corporate institutional banking
area.

65 different contact center operations,
all of various different sort of sizes,

and we're migrating those business units
onto Amazon Connect.

The reason Amazon Connect was
where we went to as well with our business

strategy was digital first and human
where it matters, which really needed us

to integrate the digital experience
with the contact center technology.

But Amazon Connect in particular,
we bought into the road map.

The amount of features
that have been released and how frequently

these new features are being released
has been really impressive.

Things like Contact Lens and transcribing
that conversation into text
and being able to mine

that data to understand
why our customers are calling, understand

those conversations so we can make those
customer experiences better over time.

One thing that is far better in my world
now that we've done
this is there's less incidents.

And the incidents that we do have
they're not as severe.

Plus, there's an economic element
to all of this.
It is cheaper to run

our current contact center on Amazon
Connect than what it was previously.
So the money we're saving
we are now putting into our people.

It's been quite a journey and we've got
more to go and the road map is exciting.
